availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Eli Ray (Hickman County, Kentucky, and Marion County, Indiana, cooper and soldier.)

body.p: Hickman County, Kentucky, and Marion County, Indiana, cooper and soldier. Indiana native. Son of James Ray. Married to Elizabeth M. Ray. Father of Nancy E. Ray, Lucinda E. Ray, Jemima E. Ray, and James A. Ray. Cooper in Hickman County, Kentucky, in 1860. Cooper in Marion County, Indiana, in 1863. Resident of Hendricks County, Indiana in 1865. Served in the 148th Indiana Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from February 7, 1865, to September 5, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Columbus, p. 476.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Indiana, Marion County, Wayne Township, p. 555B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Marion County, IN, June 1863, p. 347.
Indiana Death Certificates, 1900â€“2011, Indiana State Department of Health and Vital Records, Indiana Archives and Records Administration, Indianapolis, IN, Certificate 69.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Indiana, vol. VII (Indianapolis: Samuel M. Douglas, State Printer, 1867), 543.
